name: PixelFem #70 - Peggy Graves
description:
In 1922, the United States government passed a law regarding the length of women's bathing suits. While the requirements were adjusted as time went on, police men continued to measure women's bathing suits into the 1930s.This work depicts the moment in 1933 where two policemen were seen measuring Peggy Graves’ swimsuit as she deliberately took to the beach to defy the sexist laws. Peggy was one of many women at the time protesting through action against government regulation of the female body.

✺This work is part of PixelFems, an evolving project on the Tezos blockchain celebrating iconic women from the past and present✺
